placesVisited: Trekking in Andringitra National Park, Discovering pinnacles of Tsingy (UNESCO World Heritage Site), Spotting Golden Bamboo lemurs in Ranomafana National Park, Watching endemic birds, Geckos & lemurs Zombitse National Park, Sunset walk in Avenue of the Baobabs, Exploring Zafimaniry villages, Singing Indri Indri at Andasibe Mantadia National Park, Experience Tulear Markets, Pousse rickshaw tour of Antsirabe, Night walk in the Kirindy Reserve to spot Fossas, Hiking in Isalo National Park canyons, Madagascar Wine tasting in Fianarantsoa, Sun-downer in Antananarivo
generalInfo:
This unique and exclusive tailor made tour of Madagascar is jam-packed with wildlife and beaches so all you have to do is dive right in. Not only will you be trekking in some of Madagascar's best-loved national parks, including: Andringitra, Ranomafana and Isalo, but you'll also be watching wildlife in the company of extremely knowledgeable English-speaking guides.

From sacred rainforests and sandstone canyons to European style hill towns and UNESCO-protected tribal villages, this epic three week adventure unveils the natural and the cultural highlights, and lesser-known locations and traditional customs, one step at a time.

Having your own chauffeur-driven 4x4 vehicle lets you explore in style with a variety of B&B accommodation, in some exceptional settings, allowing you to get a real feel for the island as a whole and not just the typical tourist hot spots.

Fishing villages, wood carving centres and the terraced vineyards of Fianarantsoa will all feature on this tailor made itinerary however, for many, the chance to see lemurs, and many other indigenous wildlife species, in their natural environment, is an opportunity really worth getting worked up about.

Finally, the chance to spend time on a tropical island, fringed by palms, is just the icing on the cake. Ile Sainte Marie is an incredible beach setting and boasts no end of land-based wildlife, including abundant marine life on coral reefs, to ensure your final days in Madagascar as just as memorable as your first.

dayInfo.description: Antananarivo: ‘’Manao ahoana’’ & ‘’Salama’’ Welcome to tropical paradise. You will be welcomed & greeted by your guide or representative on arrival Antananarivo Ivato International Airport. You will travel to your hotel. Travel time approximately 15 minutes depend on the road traffic. Location: - Antananarivo; Hotel: Relais des plateaux; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Fly to Tulear: After early breakfast you will fly to Tulear at 08:30am- on arrival in Tulear Airport at 11am you will be transferred to your hotel about 30 minutes away. Location: - Tulear; Hotel: Moringa; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Tulear: In Tulear, you will have time to explore the local market which is considered as one of the main attractions of the city. You will experience a very typical southern Malagasy market where you can spot and buy the lambas (pareos). Location: - Tulear; Hotel: Moringa; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Tulear - Isalo National Park: After breakfast you will travel to Isalo National Park near Ranohira. Travel time approximately 4-5 hours. Location: - Isalo; Hotel: Isalo Rock Lodge; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Isalo National Park: Here you are at the Grand Canyon of Madagascar. Kingdom of Queen of the Isalo, cradle of a particular wild nature and an exceptional landscape, the lovers of the big escapes will be seduced by this park. It appeal is the remarkable landscape of the Jurassic Era eroded ruiniform sandstone, canyons and rare plants as well as the wildlife. Trekking Circuit of the natural swimming pool or Canyons (3 kms) 3-4 hours trekking of Isalo, there are several circuits and you can talk to the guide for the best option that suits your expectation & fitness. Most hiking circuits include the natural swimming pool. It’s really worth a dip in the natural swimming pool, it’s an oasis. These are 77 species of birds live in Isalo among which the Benson rock-thrush Pseudocossyphus bensoni, an endemic species of Madagascar that is well protected. You can also find 14 species of nocturnal lemurs, as well as ring-tailed, Verreaux’s Shifakas and red-fronted brown lemurs. In the late afternoon, you visit the Window of Isalo to see the sunset for a spectacular view. Location: - Isalo; Hotel: Isalo Rock Lodge; Board: Breakfast; Picnic Lunch & Dinner

Isalo - Ambalavao: After early breakfast you will travel to Ambalavao. Travel time approximately 5 hours. Ambalavao is a fascinating little town in the central highlands south of Fianarantsoa. The town is known for its paper-making, silk making and wines. The striking feature of this town is the architecture. The old town houses with wooden balconies. From the centre of the market you can get a good view of the town houses and the church. Ambalavoa is famous Antaimoro paper-making and you can visit the paper factory. Also you can interact with workers and try your own decoration with inlayed flowers, leaves and petals are made out of it. From simple decorative paper, it is turned into postcards, wall hangings, gift bags, lampshades and many more items. This town is the centre for Zebu (Malagasy horned cattle) trading for all the surrounding countryside. Many tribes bring their herds of cattle here to the weekly Zebu market (every Wednesday). Location: - Ambalavao; Hotel: Betsileo Country Lodge; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Ambalavao - Ranomafana: After breakfast you travel to Ranomafana, travel time 2 hours. You will discover this wonderful rainforest of Ranomafana. Ranomafana is a conservation success story in terms of many ways. Today Ranomafana plays crucial role in education and scientific research with help of Centre Valbio Research Centre. Ranomafana National Park success is because of one woman’s vision and dedication to preserve the nature and wildlife. Dr. Patricia Wright is considered to be one of the world’s foremost experts on lemurs, Wright is best known for her 26-year study of social and family interactions of wild lemurs in Ranomafana National Park, Madagascar. Ranomafana is a rainforest and spreads over 41,601 hectares in the high altitudes. There are many different forest types, from lowland rainforest to cloud forest and high plateau forest. It was classified World Natural Heritage site of the Atsinanana in 2007. It shelters a big wealth in endemic biodiversity with challenges. You can see the rare species and seriously threatened lemurs. The park is also the genetic reservoir of some rare and endemic plant species. There are many rivers and streams passes through the forest. There are several animal species have been recorded, 12 species of lemurs, including golden bamboo lemur, greater bamboo lemur, Milne-Edward’s shifaka, red bellied lemur etc, 115 species of birds. About thirty among them exist exclusively in the primary forest of the park. As well 90 species of butterflies, 98 species of amphibian and 62 species of reptiles; chameleons, lizards and fish. Your specialist park guide will explain to you the circuits available before based on your fitness, expectation and the circuits. The shortest trekking Circuit Varibolomena takes about (2-3 hrs). This soft circuit is about 3 kilometres. In the evening you will have an hour night walk along the park boarder with a guide to spot nocturnal wildlife. Location: - Ranomafana; Hotel: Setam Lodge; Board: Breakfast, Picnic Lunch & Dinner

Ranomafana - Antsirabe (journey time 4-5 hours): Today you will travel to Antsirabe through scenic route with many viewpoints to enjoy the breathtaking views. As you travel through the rural highlands, you will have breathtaking views of everyday activities of locals. Depending on the time of the year, visitors can witness the rice harvest, natural silk weaving and jewel manufacturing. From May to September ovens for clay- brick baking. You will stop for lunch in Ambositra. Ambositra is an art and crafty town located in a picturesque valley dotted with rice fields. You will have short tour of the town. This is Madagascar wood carving centre with red brick Betsileo houses. After lunch you will continue our journey towards Antsirabe. Antsirabe is the third largest city in Madagascar situated in the high altitude (about 1 500 m). The cool temperatures are in the high altitude the reason why the Norwegian Missionaries chose this city in 1872. Antsirabe is the home of one of the award winning best beers in Madagascar THB (Three Horses Beer). Its name means “where there is salt” honouring the large number of hot springs the town has, a fact that has given the city the nickname of “Malagasy Vichy”. The thermal baths had been long appreciated for their curative effects by the local population when French colonists decided to locate a thermal bath here in the 19th century. Location: - Antsirabe; Hotel: Plumeria Hotel; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Antsirabe - Antananarivo: Morning you will take pousse-pousse rickshaw tour of Antsirabe to discover this interesting city mixed with architectural styles of the colonial and evangelical past. In the European district French cottage-style houses are built next to Scandinavian villas with English style gardens. The tree-lined avenues always give some freshness whenever the sun is too bright. Afterwards you will travel to Tana. Travel time 3 hours. Location: - Antananarivo; Hotel: Belvedere; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Antananarivo - Andasibe: After breakfast you will travel to Andasibe. As the roads winds through the hairpin bends and turns you have opportunities to observe the daily activities of remote villages along this road. You will be passing terrace rice fields and bustling road side stalls with all the tropical fruits. Travel time approximately 3 hours depend on the road traffic. In the evening around 6pm you will be guided through the Analamazaotra Park on Night Walk to spot the nocturnal animals including ‘Goodman Mouse lemur. Experience the rainforest after dark where nocturnal lemurs, chameleons, geckos, frogs and fireflies come alive. The night walk can take 1½ - 2 hours. Location: -Andasibe; Hotel: Andasibe Hotel; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Andasibe: After breakfast you will visit the Andasibe-Mantadia Analamazaotra National Park Special Reserve to spot and hear the sounds of Indri Indri Lemurs. The Indri is the largest living lemurs and known as babakotos in the local Malagasy language, which means 'man of the forest' or 'little father' and unlike other lemurs, only have a short stumpy tail. Indris produce loud territorial calls that can be heard from over 1km away as you enter the park. You will be trekking through beautiful waterfalls and landscape that will lead you towards a natural swimming pool where a cascade of waterfalls. The bathing is allowed, bring your swimsuits! Along the track, where you can generally hear the screams of the Indri indri and you can also see some orchids. It is an exceptional rainforest ambiance. There many circuits to choose from depend on your fitness level. The easiest trekking with well paved paths can take from 2-3 hours up to 3 kms. Location: - Andasibe; Hotel: Andasibe Hotel; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Andasibe - Akanin'ny Nofy (Lake Ampitabe): After early breakfast you will travel to Lake Ampitabe. It’s a scenic drive dotted with travellers palm trees and thick forest until you reach Antsampanana (Market town). It’s great place to see abundance of tropical fruits in all colours and shapes. Afterwards you will take a boat to Lake Ampitabe for one hour through remote and scenic canal to Akanin’ny Nofy on the Pangalanes channel. The Pangalanes is a chain of sweet water lakes and lagoons parallel to the coast of the Indian Ocean, separated by a narrow stretch of land. Cruising on the calm waters of Pangalanes is a fascinating journey through time and history. Location: - Lake Ampitabe; Hotel: Bush House; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Akanin'ny Nofy (Lake Ampitabe): Akanin’ny Nofy or Lake Ampitabe known as nest of dreams as it provides stunning views of the lake and ocean. There are plenty activities to choose from kayaking or snorkelling. You can relax full day or take walk along the lake. Location: - Lake Ampitabe; Hotel: Bush House; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Akanin'ny Nofy (Lake Ampitabe) - Tamatave - Mahambo: After breakfast you will take a 3 hour boat ride along the Canal des Pangalanes till Tamatave. Its a scenic cruise and you may be able to spot lemurs along the way. You will have lunch at Tamatave, the port City. In the afternoon, you will drive to Mahambo Location: - Mahambo; Hotel: La Pirogue; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Mahambo - Sainte Marie: From here you travel by ferry to Sainte Marie Island. From July until September it's possible to see whales around these waters. Rest of the day at leisure Ile Saint Marie or known as Nosy Boraha in Malagasy. During the golden days of piracy it was known as Pirate Island and the only place have a dedicated pirate cemetery. Sainte-Marie became a popular settlement for the pirates who looted the commercial ships on their way back from Eastern India during the 17th and 18th Centuries. Located at the heart of the Ambodifotatra bay, “l’île aux Forbans” (pirates’ island) hosted legendary figures of piracy such as Robert Cullford, John Avery, Christophe Condent, Thomas Tew, William Kidd and Olivier Le Vasseur. The pirates were accepted by the local population and this cultural melting pot gave birth to a new ethnic group which is known as Zana- Malata. Several historical wrecks remain in Sainte-Marie, especially around the seas of “L’île aux Forbans”. Captain Kidd’s story has been told for several hundred years. A treasure map exists but no one has managed to find out about William Kidd’s hidden treasure.Stevenson himself found great inspiration in this story when he wrote his book Treasure Island. The wreck of the Adventure Galley remains in Sainte-Marie after she was discovered off the shores of “L’île aux Forbans”in 2001. Location: - Ile Sainte Marie; Hotel: Princesse Bora; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Ile Sainte Marie (Nosy Boraha): Ile Ste Marie, or Nosy Boraha, is a narrow granitic island 57 km long 8 km off the east coast of Madagascar. This tropical paradise with endless palm fringed beaches and bays surrounded by coral reefs. The island boasts lush vegetation which many species are endemic to the island. The landscapes are diverse: on the South the small Ile aux Nattes with a magnificent lagoon, on the East the mangroves, on the North the natural swimming pools, the forests on the centre and most of the activity to the West. The island lush vegetation with orchids, clove trees, cinnamon, vanilla, and many others. Full day relaxing or you can take an optional Excursion Whale Watching or Island Tour. This is full day excursion to discover the most beautiful landscapes of Saint Marie during the day. You’ll across small villages, forest, wild beaches, mangroves, rice fields and so much more. You’ll learn everything about vanilla, cinnamon, clove and orchids and the Malagasy way of life in the island. Location: - Sainte Marie; Hotel: Princesse Bora; Board: Breakfast & Dinner
Ile Sainte Marie (Nosy Boraha): At leisure. Location: - Sainte Marie; Hotel: Princesse Bora; Board: Breakfast & Dinner

Ile Sainte Marie (Nosy Boraha) - Antananarivo: Today you will take a short 50 minutes flight to the capital Antananarivo. Afternoon will discover Antananarivo and described as city of thousand warriors. You will start in upper town (“La Haute ville”), where Palaces (Queen's palace, ancient Prime Minister Rainilaiarivony palace, ancient Justice Palace), cathedrals and the residential area of (mostly) ancient noblemen families are located. From here, visitors enjoy a nice perspective of the city below far away from the hassle of downtown. You can also buy souvenirs around here. Sundowner in the Lakonga, its best place to say cheers to great trip around Madagascar with a beautiful view of Antananarivo. Location: - Antananarivo; Hotel: Le pavillon de Lemyrne; Board: Breakfast & Dinner
Antananarivo - Your Destination: In the morning if you like you can do shopping to buy souvenirs or explore the city. Depending on flight Schedule you will travel to the airport.
